intro: Oreoselinum minus, commonly known as lesser parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils. The plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and delicate flowers make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
